text.5: Maka barangsiapa memberikan (hartanya di jalan Allah) dan bertakwa,
text.7: maka akan Kami mudahkan baginya jalan menuju kemudahan (kebahagiaan),
text.8: dan adapun orang yang kikir dan merasa dirinya cukup (tidak perlu pertolongan Allah),
text.10: maka akan Kami mudahkan baginya jalan menuju kesukaran (kesengsaraan),
text.11: dan hartanya tidak bermanfaat baginya apabila dia telah binasa.
text.13: dan sesungguhnya milik Kamilah akhirat dan dunia itu.
text.14: Maka Aku memperingatkan kamu dengan neraka yang menyala-nyala,
text.15: yang hanya dimasuki oleh orang yang paling celaka,
text.17: Dan akan dijauhkan darinya (neraka) orang yang paling bertakwa,
text.18: yang menginfakkan hartanya (di jalan Allah) untuk membersihkan (dirinya),
text.19: dan tidak ada seorang pun memberikan suatu nikmat padanya yang harus dibalasnya,
text.20: tetapi (dia memberikan itu semata-mata) karena mencari keridaan Tuhannya Yang Mahatinggi.
text.21: Dan niscaya kelak dia akan mendapat kesenangan (yang sempurna).

text.1: By the night when it covers,
text.2: And by the day when it shines in brightness,
text.3: And by [Him] who created the male and female,
text.5: As for he who gives and fears Allah,
text.7: We will ease him toward ease.
text.8: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need,
text.10: We will ease him toward difficulty.
text.11: And his wealth will not avail him when he falls.
text.13: And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the world.
text.14: So I have warned you of a Fire blazing fiercely,
text.15: None will enter it except the most wretched one,
text.17: But the righteous will be kept away from it -
text.18: He who gives of his wealth to purify himself,
text.19: And does not confer a favor upon anyone for a reward,
text.20: But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, the Most High.
text.21: And he is sure to be pleased.

id.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: Allah bersumpah dengan malam apabila menutupi, yaitu ketika malam sudah merata menutupi alam ini. Ini adalah waktu isya yaitu ketika cahaya merah sudah hilang di ufuk barat. Waktu itu manusia pada umumnya sudah mengakhiri aktivitasnya, dan ingin istirahat dan pergi tidur. Kemudian Allah bersumpah dengan aktivitas alam sebaliknya, yaitu siang ketika terang benderang. Waktu itu adalah waktu duha ketika cahaya matahari sudah merata menyinari alam ini, yang kontras dengan malam yang baru saja berakhir, dan manusia mulai bekerja.
text.2: Allah bersumpah dengan malam apabila menutupi, yaitu ketika malam sudah merata menutupi alam ini. Ini adalah waktu isya yaitu ketika cahaya merah sudah hilang di ufuk barat. Waktu itu adalah waktu duha ketika cahaya matahari sudah merata menyinari alam ini, yang kontras dengan malam yang baru saja berakhir, dan manusia mulai bekerja.
text.3: Selanjutnya, Allah bersumpah dengan laki-laki dan perempuan yang telah diciptakan-Nya. Ini adalah juga dua makhluk yang berlawanan jenis dan kodratnya.
text.4: Setelah bersumpah dengan dua-dua makhluk-Nya yang berlawanan jenis dan sifatnya, Allah menegaskan bahwa perbuatan atau tingkah laku manusia itu memang bermacam-macam. Perbedaan itu terjadi karena perbedaan kemauannya, apakah mengikuti potensi positifnya ataukah mengikuti potensi negatifnya.
text.5:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan adanya tiga tingkah laku manusia. Pertama, suka memberi, yaitu menolong antara sesama manusia. Ia tidak hanya mengeluarkan zakat kekayaannya, yang merupakan kewajiban, tetapi juga berinfak, bersedekah, dan sebagainya yang bukan wajib. Kedua, bertakwa, yaitu takut mengabaikan perintah-Nya atau melanggar larangan-Nya. 

Ketiga, membenarkan kebaikan Allah, yaitu mengakui nikmat-nikmat yang telah diberikan kepadanya lalu mensyukurinya. Nikmat terbesar Allah yang ia akui adalah surga. Oleh karena itu, ia tidak segan-segan beramal di dunia untuk memperolehnya, di antaranya membantu antara sesama manusia.

Kepada mereka yang melakukan tiga aspek perbuatan baik di atas, Allah akan memberikan kemudahan bagi mereka, yaitu kemudahan untuk memperoleh keberuntungan di dunia maupun di akhirat.

Sebaliknya, ada manusia yang bertingkah laku sebaliknya. Ia bakhil, pelit, tidak mau menolong antar sesama, apalagi mengeluarkan kewajibannya yaitu zakat. Di samping itu, ia sudah merasa cukup segala-galanya. Oleh karena itu, ia merasa tidak memerlukan orang lain bahkan Allah. Akibatnya, ia sombong dan tidak mengakui nikmat-nikmat Allah yang telah ia terima dan tidak mengharapkan nikmat-nikmat itu. Akibatnya ia tidak mengindahkan aturan-aturan Allah. Orang itu akan dimudahkan Allah menuju kesulitan, baik kesulitan di dunia maupun di akhirat. Kesulitan di dunia misalnya kejatuhan, penyakit, kecelakaan, musibah, dan sebagainya. Kesulitan di akhirat adalah ketersiksaan yang puncaknya adalah neraka.

Manusia, bila sudah mati tanpa memiliki amal dan kemudian masuk neraka di akhirat, maka harta benda dan kekayaan mereka tidak berguna apa pun. Hal itu karena harta itu tidak akan bisa digunakan untuk menebus dosa-dosa mereka.

Allah menegaskan bahwa Ia berkewajiban menunjuki manusia mana jalan yang benar dan mana jalan yang salah, mana yang baik dan mana yang buruk, sebagaimana dinyatakan-Nya dalam ayat lain:

Dan apabila orang-orang yang beriman kepada ayat-ayat Kami datang kepadamu, maka katakanlah, "Salamun 'alaikum (selamat sejahtera untuk kamu)." Tuhanmu telah menetapkan sifat kasih sayang pada diri-Nya, (yaitu) barang siapa berbuat kejahatan di antara kamu karena kebodohan, kemudian dia bertobat setelah itu dan memperbaiki diri, maka Dia Maha Pengampun, Maha Penyayang. (al-An'am/6: 54)
text.13: Allah juga pemilik alam ini, baik alam akhirat maupun alam dunia. Bila Allah pemilik segala-galanya, maka tiada jalan bagi manusia selain meminta semuanya itu kepada-Nya dengan jalan mengimani dan bertakwa kepada-Nya.
text.14: Di samping Allah telah menunjuki manusia jalan yang benar, Ia juga memperingatkan manusia tentang adanya neraka yang senantiasa menyala-nyala. Penghuni neraka itu adalah mereka yang paling durhaka, yaitu orang-orang yang senantiasa memandang dusta wahyu-wahyu yang disampaikan kepadanya, dan karena itu tidak mau mengimaninya dan menjalankannya.
text.15: Di samping Allah telah menunjuki manusia jalan yang benar, Ia juga memperingatkan manusia tentang adanya neraka yang senantiasa menyala-nyala. text.21: Orang takwa yang membantu orang lain untuk mencari rida Allah itu akhirnya akan memperolehnya. Orang itu terjauh dari neraka, dan pasti masuk surga.

en.name: The Night
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: Allah swears by the night when it covers, that is, when the night has completely covered this universe. This is the time of Isha, when the red light has disappeared on the western horizon. At that time, people generally have finished their activities and want to rest and go to sleep. Then Allah swears by the opposite activity of nature, which is the day when it is bright and clear. That time is the time of Dhuha, when the sunlight has evenly illuminated this universe, which is in contrast to the night that has just ended, and people begin to work.
text.2: Allah swears by the night when it covers, that is, when the night has evenly covered this universe. This is the time of Isha, when the red light has disappeared on the western horizon. At that time, people generally have finished their activities and want to rest and go to sleep. Then Allah swears by the opposite activity of nature, which is the day when it is bright and clear. That time is the time of Dhuha, when the sunlight has evenly illuminated this universe, which is in contrast to the night that has just ended, and people begin to work.
text.3: Furthermore, Allah swears by the male and female that He has created. These are also two creatures of opposite genders and natures.
text.4: After swearing by His two creations that are of opposite genders and natures, Allah affirms that the deeds or behaviors of humans are indeed varied. This difference occurs because of the difference in their will, whether they follow their positive potential or follow their negative potential.
text.5:
In this verse, Allah explains the existence of three types of human behavior. First, being fond of giving, which is helping one another. He not only gives zakat from his wealth, which is an obligation, but also spends in infaq, gives sadaqah, and so on, which are not obligatory. Second, being pious (taqwa), which is fearing to neglect His commands or violate His prohibitions.

Third, affirming the goodness of Allah, which is acknowledging the blessings that have been given to him and then being grateful for them. The greatest blessing of Allah that he acknowledges is Paradise (Jannah). Therefore, he does not hesitate to do good deeds in the world to obtain it, including helping one another.

To those who perform the three aspects of good deeds above, Allah will grant them ease, namely ease in obtaining good fortune in this world and in the hereafter.

text.7:
In this verse, Allah explains the existence of three types of human behavior. First, being fond of giving, which is helping one another. He not only gives zakat from his wealth, which is an obligation, but also spends in charity (infak), gives alms (sedekah), and so on, which are not obligatory. Second, being pious (taqwa), which is fearing to neglect His commands or violate His prohibitions.

Third, affirming the goodness of Allah, which is acknowledging the blessings that have been given to him and then being grateful for them. The greatest blessing of Allah that he acknowledges is Paradise (Jannah). Therefore, he does not hesitate to do good deeds in the world to obtain it, including helping one another.

To those who perform these three aspects of good deeds, Allah will grant them ease, namely ease in obtaining good fortune in this world and in the Hereafter.
text.8:
Conversely, there are people who behave in the opposite way. They are stingy, miserly, unwilling to help one another, let alone fulfill their obligation, which is zakat. In addition to that, they already feel sufficient in everything. Therefore, they feel they do not need other people, or even Allah. As a result, they are arrogant and do not acknowledge the blessings of Allah that they have received and do not hope for those blessings. Consequently, they disregard the rules of Allah. That person will be facilitated by Allah towards difficulty, both difficulty in this world and in the hereafter. Difficulty in this world, for example, includes downfall, illness, accidents, calamities, and so on. Difficulty in the hereafter is torment, the peak of which is hell.

If humans die without having any good deeds and then enter hell in the hereafter, then their possessions and wealth are of no use whatsoever. This is because that wealth cannot be used to redeem their sins.

text.12:
Allah affirms that He is obligated to guide mankind to the right path and the wrong path, to what is good and what is bad, as He stated in another verse:

And when those who believe in Our verses come to you, say, "Salamun 'alaikum (Peace be upon you)." Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy. Indeed, whoever among you does a wrong out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful. (al-An'am/6: 54)
text.13: Allah is also the owner of this universe, both the hereafter and the world. If Allah is the owner of everything, then there is no way for humans other than to ask for all of it from Him by believing in Him and being mindful of Him (taqwa).
text.14: Besides Allah having guided mankind to the right path, He also warns mankind about the existence of Hell, which is constantly blazing. The inhabitants of Hell are those who are most rebellious, namely those who constantly consider the revelations conveyed to them to be lies, and therefore do not want to believe in them or act upon them.
text.15: Besides Allah guiding mankind to the right path, He also warns mankind about the existence of Hellfire that is constantly blazing. The inhabitants of Hellfire are those who are most rebellious, namely those who constantly consider the revelations conveyed to them as lies, and therefore refuse to believe in them and practice them.
text.16: Besides Allah guiding mankind to the right path, He also warns mankind about the existence of Hell that is constantly blazing. The inhabitants of Hell are those who are most rebellious, namely those who constantly consider the revelations conveyed to them as lies, and therefore refuse to believe in them and practice them.
text.17: Conversely, there are the pious, namely those who give their wealth to help others purify themselves. The pious will be kept far from the Fire. An example of the most pious person is Abu Bakr as-Siddiq, who used all his wealth to free weak people and women who had embraced Islam and to help them.
text.18: Conversely, there are the pious, those who give their wealth to help others purify themselves. The pious will be kept far away from the Fire. An example of the most pious person is Abu Bakr as-Siddiq, who used all his wealth to free weak people and women who embraced Islam and to help them.
text.19: Those who are righteous help others not because that person has done them a favor that they need to repay. They help that person solely because they hope for the pleasure and Paradise of Allah in the Hereafter.
text.20: Those who are righteous help others not because that person has done them a favor that they need to repay. They help that person solely because they hope for the pleasure and Paradise of Allah in the Hereafter.
text.21: The pious person who helps others to seek the pleasure of Allah will ultimately attain it. That person is kept far from the Fire, and will certainly enter Paradise.
